text: Frederick "Fred" Burlew (March 20, 1871 – May 3, 1927) was an American Thoroughbred racehorse trainer. He was the trainer of the winning horse of the Kentucky Derby in 1922. He was inducted into the National Museum of Racing and Hall of Fame in 1973. ==References== Category:1871 births Category:1927 deaths Category:American horse trainers Category:United States Thoroughbred Racing Hall of Fame inductees Category:Sportspeople from Cincinnati
title: Fred Burlew
